content.text:
Midday (12:05:00) in the Athenaeum of Whispered Tomes—your eyes drift away from Archivist Thessa's penetrating gaze to take in your surroundings.

The grand reading hall stretches before you, a cathedral of knowledge. Towering bookshelves of dark oak reach toward the vaulted ceiling, their iron rungs bearing countless tomes bound in faded leather, cracked vellum, and something that looks unsettlingly like scaled skin. High arched windows frame the exterior—rolling hills and distant forest beyond, but the light they cast is thin and grey.

Rows of long oak tables fill the center of the hall, occupied by hunched scholars. A young man with ink-stained fingers copies from a crumbling codex nearby, his quill scratching furiously. Across the way, an elderly woman annotates margins of a massive star chart, muttering calculations to herself. Near the windows, a hooded figure pores over a text you can't see, their face shadowed beneath a cowl.

The air is thick with the scent of aged parchment, beeswax, and something faintly metallic—old ink, perhaps, or secrets.

To your left, the public archives stretch onward, shelves disappearing into dim recesses. To your right, the chain-link barrier of the restricted section gleams faintly, its lock heavy and ancient.

Behind the desk, Archivist Thessa watches you with those sharp grey eyes, waiting.
